ai.summary: Mullyfa Trail is a demanding 18.8 km hiking route in the UK. It combines long ascents with varied terrain, including rough paths, marshy ground, and exposed sections. The route tests endurance and navigation skills, suitable for experienced hikers prepared for changeable UK weather.
ai.terrain_summary: The hike features long grassy climbs, rocky stretches, and muddy tracks. Expect uneven surfaces, potential bogs, and sections with limited handholds. Trails may pass through woodland, open moorland, and pasture; navigation can be challenging in poor visibility.
ai.safety_notes: This is a hard hike in often-changeable UK conditions. Always check the forecast, daylight hours, and any path closures before setting out. Wear sturdy boots with good grip and waterproof layers. Carry enough water and high-energy snacks, a map or GPS, a fully charged phone, and a small first‑aid kit. Tell someone your planned route and ETA. Bring a whistle, emergency blanket, and headlamp in case of delay. Be prepared for boggy ground, slick rocks, and sudden weather changes; turn back if conditions deteriorate.
recommended_gear: Sturdy hiking boots with good ankle support
Weather-appropriate layers (base layer, fleece, waterproof shell)
Water supply (2–3 litres) and high-energy snacks
Map and compass or GPS device
Fully charged phone and power bank
ai.best_seasons: Late spring to early autumn (roughly May to September) offer longer daylight and more stable conditions for this long, hard hike. Autumn can be damp and windy; winter hiking is possible but requires extra preparation and shorter daylight.

seo.title: Mullyfa Trail – 18.8 km Hard Hike in the UK
seo.meta_description: Plan your Mullyfa Trail hike in the UK. An 18.8 km hard route with varied terrain, safety tips, gear lists, and best seasons.
